meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by music studies and academic expectations
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Kimberly, a first-year music major. I’ve taken a few music courses and really enjoyed them, but I’m also in a honors-level music major and a lot of what I’m doing is studying music theory, history, and performance. I’ve been in classes with very talented students, and I feel like I’m taking on a lot of pressure to perform well. I’m also in a research-intensive major, and I’m worried that I’m not doing enough research to prepare for music school. I’m feeling really stressed and anxious about everything I’m doing, and I don’t know if I’m doing okay.

meeting_request.purpose: Help with understanding course material and estimating grades
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Sonia, a third-year Computer Science major. Last semester was really challenging — I took a lot of advanced courses that I didn't really understand, and I ended up with a lot of lower grades. I felt overwhelmed and unsure if I was doing well enough to pass. Now I'm in a more technical course this semester, and I'm still not sure what to expect. I'm worried that I'll get a lower grade again, and I'm starting to panic. I'm majoring in CS because I love technology and want to work in it, but I don't know if that's what I should be doing. I'm feeling disconnected from the academic community in my major and worried that I'm not connecting with the right people. I'm hoping to talk with someone who can help me understand what I'm doing in class, how to approach assignments better, and how to stay on track.

meeting_request.purpose: Need help improving writing skills in my major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Brandon, a junior majoring in English. I’ve been doing okay academically, but lately I’ve been struggling with writing assignments. Some of the essays I’ve written have been okay, but I keep making mistakes. I feel like I’m not doing anything right in my major. I’m not sure if I should be in English or something else, but I’m really passionate about the subject and want to do well. I’m hoping to talk to someone about how to improve and get help.

meeting_request.purpose: Need help staying in my major and understanding my weaknesses
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Jacqueline, a second-year Psychology major. I’ve taken a lot of interesting and challenging courses, but lately I’ve been struggling to keep up. Some of my classes have covered topics like addiction, trauma, and mental health, and I’ve found them really interesting but not necessarily applicable to my major. I’m also feeling frustrated because I’ve been doing well in other parts of my life, like my extracurriculars and academic performance overall, but I’m not sure if I should be in this major anymore. I’d really appreciate help understanding what's been happening and how to improve my academic performance without dropping the major entirely.

meeting_request.purpose: Need help improving writing skills in my major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Joe, a third-year English major. Last semester was really rough academically, and I ended up with a B in English based on a mix of lower-level courses and a few major-specific papers. I struggled with writing, and I didn't realize how much I was falling behind until now. I'm taking more English and literature courses this semester, but I still feel like I'm not doing well in them. I'm not sure how to improve my writing skills, especially since I'm not doing research or writing papers like I did last semester. I'm also worried that my grades might drop again if I don't do better. I'm hoping to talk to someone about how to get better at writing in my major and how to stay on track this semester.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed and unsure if I can keep up in this major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Mary, a second-year Political Science major. I’ve taken a few interesting but unrelated courses lately, like “Government and Society” and “International Relations and Politics”, and I’m finding it hard to keep up with the content and pace. Some of the topics are really complex and I’m not familiar with the theories or methods used in these fields, and I’m feeling like I’m falling behind both academically and emotionally. I’m also dealing with some personal issues that are affecting my focus and motivation, and I’m not sure if I should be still in the Political Science major or if I should switch to something else. I’m really enjoying the intellectual content of my classes, but I’m starting to feel overwhelmed and worried that I’m not cut out for this major.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed and unsure if I can keep up in my education
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Aaron, a third-year student majoring in Education. I’ve taken a lot of interesting courses, from history to education policy to teaching methods. But even though I’ve done well academically, I’ve started to feel like I’m not quite fitting in or understanding what I’m doing. I’m not sure if I should be in the education major or if I should switch to something else, but I’m worried I’m falling behind and not doing well enough to graduate on time. I’m also struggling with personal essays and feeling like I don’t have a strong voice as a student. I’d love to talk with someone about how to stay on track and feel more confident in my education.

meeting_request.purpose: Struggling academically and feeling lost in my major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Eric, a senior majoring in East Asian Languages and Literatures. Last semester was really tough — I fell behind in most of my courses, and I’m still not back on track. My grades are down significantly, and I’m starting to feel really discouraged. I’ve been struggling with writing and reading in Chinese, and I’m not sure if I even understand what I’m doing wrong. I’ve been talking to my professors, but they seem frustrated by my performance and are encouraging me to take a break. I’m also dealing with personal issues that have been weighing me down, and I’m not sure how to balance both academics and my personal life. I’m feeling really overwhelmed and not sure if I’m going to make it through this semester without falling further behind.

meeting_request.purpose: Struggling academically and uncertain first-year experience
meeting_request.description: Hi, my name is Sandra and I'm a first-year student in Romance Languages major. I’ve taken undergraduate courses in Spanish and French, and I’ve been doing okay in classes like literature and language theory, but I’ve never really been in a high-stakes environment like this one. My major is still being evaluated, and I’m still in the first semester. I feel overwhelmed by the workload and uncertain about how to succeed. I’m struggling with grades, feeling isolated, and questioning if I’m even cut out for this major. I’d like some guidance on how to improve academically and how to navigate this new environment.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by my first-year geography course and unsure if I can keep up
meeting_request.description: Hi, my name is Richard and I'm a first-year student in the geography major. I’ve taken a few classes so far, including anthropology and geography. Both of these courses are really interesting, but I’m finding it hard to keep up with the content and the pace. I’m still in college, and I’m still trying to figure out what I want to do with my major. I feel like I’m already falling behind, and I don’t know if I can keep doing this on my own. I’m also dealing with some personal stress from school and family issues, and I’m not sure if I’m handling it well. I’m interested in talking with someone about how to manage my academic load and my mental health, and I think this is a good opportunity.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by the academic expectations and social isolation in my art major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Joel, a first-year art major. I’ve been in the arts program at this university, and so far I’ve taken a lot of really interesting courses, including a studio art class on environmental art and another one on the history of art and race. But I’m also in a really large arts program with a lot of students, and I’m feeling like everyone else in my class is already ahead of me academically, and I don’t know if I can keep up. I also really love art, but I feel like I don’t fit into the social aspects of the major, like how to connect with other artists or find a community. I’m not sure if this is just a first-year feeling or if I’m going to be really isolated in this major if I keep going.

meeting_request.purpose: Help deciding between major and career options
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm John, a second-year Earth and Environmental Geosciences major. I'm really enjoying my major and the courses I'm taking, but I'm not sure if I want to pursue a traditional environmental science career or something more specialized like environmental policy or outreach. I'm still in the early stages of my major, and I'm worried about whether I'll be ready for a more advanced career in environmental science or if I should focus more on academic research or public engagement. I'm also concerned about the job market for students with environmental majors right now, especially with the recent political climate around climate change and environmental issues.

meeting_request.purpose: Need help staying in my major and understanding my weaknesses
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Lori, a second-year Psych major. I’ve taken a lot of interesting courses, but I’m not really sure what I’m good at yet. My psychology professor even acknowledged that I’m not really interested in the major, but I keep pushing myself. I’m also taking some neuroscience and language courses, but I’m not sure if those are even related to psychology. I feel like I’m falling behind, and I don’t know if I can keep doing this. I’m doing okay academically, but I’m starting to feel overwhelmed and worried about whether I’m even qualified to major in psychology. I’d love to talk to someone about how to improve my academic performance without sacrificing my passion or understanding of the field.

meeting_request.purpose: Struggling to keep up with advanced CS courses
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Jose, a third-year Computer Science major. I’ve been taking a lot of technical courses lately, and I’m starting to feel overwhelmed. In my first two semesters, I took two CS classes and two math classes, and I ended up with a B in each one. But now I’m taking three more advanced CS courses, and I’m starting to get a little bit behind. My grades are still okay, but I’m starting to feel like I’m falling behind, and I’m worried that I’m not going to be able to keep up this semester. I’m also taking a couple of electives, including a course on machine learning and another on computer security. I’m not sure if these courses are going to be harder than the ones I’ve already been doing, and I’m worried that I’m going to fall behind again.

meeting_request.purpose: Need help staying in my history course but feeling overwhelmed
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Marcus, a senior in history. I’ve taken a lot of history courses over the past few years, and I’ve ended up majoring in history. This semester, I’m taking a history of Europe course that I really enjoy, but I’m feeling a bit overwhelmed by the material. My professor has been really helpful, but sometimes it feels like there’s a lot of information to digest, and I just don’t know where to start. I’m also taking a history of the Americas course next semester, and I’m not sure if I should be taking both of those or just focus on one. I’m feeling frustrated and worried that I’m falling behind, and I’m not sure if I’m doing anything wrong or if I should be worried about graduating on time.

meeting_request.purpose: Need help improving my writing and presentation skills
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Chad, a second-year Writing Studies major. I’ve been doing well academically, but I’m finding it harder than usual to write effectively, especially in my writing-intensive courses. Last semester, I took a writing seminar and a research paper, and both were really difficult. I spent hours drafting papers, but then I would get stuck on the same structure or analysis, and I would end up with a mess of a draft. This semester, I’m taking a writing seminar and a research paper again, and I’m already behind on my work. I know I need to improve, but I find writing and presentation difficult even when I know what I’m doing. I’m not sure how to get better, so I’m reaching out to talk about strategies. I want to work with a tutor or mentor to work on a writing plan, practice writing in different contexts, and learn how to present my work effectively.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling disconnected from my major and uncertain about my future
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Cheryl, a first-year Political Science major. I’ve taken a few classes and already feel like I’m in a different world than what I’m used to doing. Some of my classes are really heavy on political theory and history, and I’m not really interested in that. Other than that, I’m not really sure what I’m supposed to be doing here. I’m trying to major in something I’m really passionate about (environmental policy), but I’m not sure if I even fit in here or if I should be switching things up. I’m also feeling really isolated from other students in my major, and I don’t know if I’m alone in feeling this way.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling lost and uncertain about my career path
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Ryan, a senior Art major in my final year. I’ve enjoyed the course very much, but I’m also feeling a bit disillusioned about what the future holds for the arts. I’ve always loved art, but I don’t know if I want to pursue a career in it. I’m not sure what I should be studying or doing, and I feel like I’m losing touch with what I’m passionate about. I’m also worried about the economic and social impact of the arts, and I’m worried that I might be leaving something important behind if I don’t figure out what to do soon.

meeting_request.purpose: Help with academic pressure and uncertainty in my economics course
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Lauren, a second-year Economics major. Last semester was really challenging for me academically. I took a number of difficult and advanced economics courses, and I ended up with a B-minus average in my major. It was really hard to keep up, and I started to feel overwhelmed. Now, this semester, I'm taking more economics-related courses and I'm still struggling. I'm also dealing with some personal stress and anxiety, and I'm not sure if my academic performance is going to keep up with my emotional and mental health. I'm taking this course because it's part of my major, but I feel like I'm not doing well enough to keep up. I'm worried that I'll fall behind again and get a bad grade, which will make me feel even more anxious and discouraged.

meeting_request.purpose: Struggling to understand religious beliefs in a post-Christian world
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Noah, a senior majoring in Religion. Last semester was really challenging — I struggled with understanding faith in a post-Christian world, and I’m still grappling with how to reconcile my faith with the new beliefs and values emerging in society. I’ve tried talking to professors, but they don’t seem to know how to address my specific concerns. I’m interested in exploring how I can engage with religious studies in a more nuanced way and learn how to think critically about faith in the modern world. I hope to schedule a meeting to discuss how to build skills and perspectives that will help me navigate this challenging period.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed and unsure if I can keep up in this major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Rebecca, a senior majoring in Politics at UC Berkeley. I’ve taken a lot of political science and international relations courses, and I’ve really enjoyed them but I’m finding it harder than expected to apply what I’ve learned in class to real-world issues. Some of my courses have focused on issues like immigration, climate change, or human rights, and I’m trying to connect what I’ve read to what I’m doing in my internships and student organizations. I feel like I’m falling behind, even though I’ve been working hard. I’d like some help understanding what I’m doing well in my major and how to stay on track, or advice on how to engage more meaningfully with the issues I’m studying.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed and unsure if I can keep up in this major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Alexa, a third-year Political Science major. I’ve taken a bunch of political and social science courses lately and I’m really enjoying them, but I’m also feeling a lot more interested in business and humanities than I was before. I’ve always been interested in politics, but I never thought I’d be in a major that would involve so much of it. I’m majoring because I think it’s a good fit for my interests, but I’m also starting to feel like I’m not doing well in the classes and I don’t know if I can keep up. I want some help understanding what I’m doing well in and what areas need work, and I’m open to any advice or strategies.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by first-year classes and my major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Kimberly, a first-year English major. I’ve taken two difficult classes so far and feel like I’m falling behind. I’m still in the learning process, but I’m worried I’ll fail my major and feel like I’m not cut out for college. I’m also dealing with anxiety around school and personal goals. I’d like some support dealing with these emotions and figuring out how to thrive in this major.

meeting_request.purpose: Struggling with depression and feeling lost after graduation
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Caroline, a senior Religious Studies major. Last semester was really tough — I struggled with depression and anxiety, and I’m still dealing with those issues now. I felt like everything was falling apart, and I felt like I was lost without a clear sense of purpose. I ended up taking a lot of classes that weren’t directly related to my major, and I ended up overloading with coursework and feeling overwhelmed. I started talking to friends and faculty about how I was feeling, but I didn’t realize how deep the depression was until I started feeling like I was losing control. I’m still trying to figure out what comes next, and I feel like I’m not alone in this. I want to talk to someone about how to get better and work on rebuilding my sense of self and direction.

meeting_request.purpose: Help with academic challenges and self-doubt
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Patricia, a third-year Physics and Astronomy major. This semester has been tough as I'm taking a mix of physics and math courses, and I'm already behind in some of my classes. I'm feeling overwhelmed and questioning if I even like the subject or if I'm doing something wrong. I'm also experiencing a lot of self-doubt, especially around my academic performance. I feel like everyone else is ahead of me and I'm falling behind, even though I've been working hard. I'm worried that I'll fail these courses and lose faith in my ability to succeed in this major. I want help to feel more confident in my work and to find a way to stay engaged in my studies.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling lost and uncertain about what to do next after starting college
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m James, a first-year Political Science major. I’ve taken a few electives so far and really enjoyed some of the history and sociology courses, but I’m still not sure what I want to do with my major. I’ve been thinking about working in politics or nonprofits, but I’m not sure if that’s the right path or if I need to explore other options first. I’m also feeling overwhelmed by all the information I’ve already taken and the demands of college, especially since I’m not in a major that requires a lot of writing or critical thinking. I’m not sure if I should be feeling this way, but it’s definitely affecting my academic and personal engagement.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by my first-year Chemistry class and academic expectations
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m John, a first-year majoring in Chemistry. I’ve taken a few courses so far and already feel like I’m in over my head. Some of the readings have been really difficult, and the material is really complex. I’m worried that I’m not doing well enough to pass the class, and I’m starting to panic. I’m also really interested in the chemistry of addiction and how drugs work, but I don’t know if I’m even eligible to take that course or if it’s just too advanced for me. I’m feeling really isolated in my major and worried that everyone else is ahead of me, which is making me even more anxious. I’d love to talk to someone about how to manage my academic and emotional stress, and I’m excited to meet with you about trying something different in my first semester.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed and unsure if I can keep up in my history course
meeting_request.description: Hi, my name is Robert and I'm a fourth-year History major. This is the final semester of my major, and I’m really feeling the pressure to do well. Last year, I took a lot of history classes and ended up with a 3.5 GPA, but this semester I’m taking more advanced courses and I’m worried I won’t be able to keep up. I’m also involved in a few academic clubs and am trying to balance my studies with extracurriculars and internships. I feel like I’m falling behind, but I don’t know if I’m even doing the right things. I’m hoping to talk with someone who can help me manage my academic load and work on improving my skills in history.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling discouraged and unsure if I can graduate
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Sara, a fourth-year History major. I’ve been doing really well in my classes, with a 3.8 GPA. But lately, I’ve been feeling more anxious about my grades and worried that I won’t be able to keep up. I’ve also been struggling with some of the more historical or theoretical aspects of my courses, and I’m finding it harder to connect with the material in a meaningful way. I’m feeling overwhelmed by everything I’ve already done, and not sure if I can keep going. I’m hoping to talk to someone about how to stay focused and improve my academic performance, but I’m not sure how to ask for help or what to say. I’m also interested in exploring some creative writing or digital media options as a way to shift my focus away from history and into something more contemporary or experimental.

meeting_request.purpose: Frustrated about failing harder courses
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Dennis, a third-year music major. I've been doing well in some of my upper-level music courses, like harmony and counterpoint, but I'm starting to feel like I'm falling behind in harder and more abstract ones. Last semester, I took two harder music theory courses and another one on jazz improvisation. I got a C- in each one, and I'm not sure if I did enough to pass. Now I'm in a music elective that's more like the ones I'm struggling in, and I'm worried I'll get a D or lower. I feel frustrated and discouraged, and I don't know if I'm even doing enough to keep up. I'm hoping to talk to someone about how to improve my performance in music courses, especially since I'm in a major.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed and unsure if I can keep up in my education
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Nancy, a second-year student in the education major. I’ve been taking a lot of classes, from English to sociology to education studies. Some of them are interesting, but others are just really heavy and over my head. I’m struggling to keep up with grades, and I’m worried I’ll fall behind and lose interest. I’m also feeling frustrated by the content and the way it’s being presented. I’d love to talk about what I’m doing wrong and how to improve, but I don’t know how to ask for help or how to make progress in my major.

meeting_request.purpose: Struggling to adjust to college and find my footing
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Selena, a first-year Sociology major. I’ve taken a mix of humanities and social science courses, but I’m still trying to figure out what I’m supposed to do here. My major is interesting, but I don’t really know what I’m supposed to be doing. I’ve taken some classes that are really heavy on social issues, but I don’t really understand how to apply that to my major. I also feel like I don’t fit in with the other students here, even though I’m from a different socioeconomic background. I’m worried I’m not doing well enough to be a Sociology major, and I’m not sure how to get help.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by first-year classes and my major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Matthew, a first-year English major. I’ve taken two difficult classes so far and am already feeling like I’m falling behind. I’m worried that I’m not measuring up to my major, and I’m worried that I’m not doing well enough to succeed. I’d like some support dealing with academic pressure and first-year anxiety.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed and unsure if I'm on track in my environmental studies major
meeting_request.description: Hi, my name is Michelle and I'm a first-year student majoring in Environmental Studies. This is my first semester in college, and I’ve already taken a few major-specific courses and some general environmental studies classes. However, I’m feeling a lot more stressed than I thought I would be, and I’m questioning if I even belong in this major or if I should be switching to something else. I also feel really burned out from school and feeling like I’m doing something important, but I don’t know if that's what I’m doing. I'm worried I'm not doing well enough to be in this major, and I'm not sure how to get help.

meeting_request.purpose: Need help staying in my history major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Kim, a second year history major. Last semester was really tough — I struggled in my history of Europe course and got a D- on the final exam. I’m not sure if I’m doing something wrong this year, or if I’m just not cut out for the major. I’m trying to stay in the department, but it’s not helping. I’m interested in internships and career paths related to history, but I’m not sure how to get involved or what courses I should be taking to get ready. I’m also interested in exploring other majors, but I don’t know if history is the right fit for me. I want to talk to someone about how to stay in my major and improve my academic performance.

meeting_request.purpose: Need help improving grades and understanding material
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Sabrina, a third-year chemistry major. I’ve been taking a wide variety of courses, from organic chemistry to biochemistry to physics, and I’m trying my best to keep up with the material. However, most of the content is still new to me, and I feel overwhelmed by what I’m learning. My professor’s been helpful, but I’m also feeling frustrated and uncertain about whether I’m doing something wrong or if I’m just not cut out for this major. I’m currently in a chemistry seminar and am also taking a bioinformatics course, which is adding to my load. I’m worried that I’m falling behind and will eventually fall behind even more if I keep this up. I’d really appreciate help understanding what I’m doing well in the major, what areas need improvement, and how to stay on track without feeling overwhelmed. I’d also think about exploring other majors or career paths that might be more aligned with my interests and skills.

meeting_request.purpose: I’m feeling overwhelmed by my history coursework and worried about passing the major with a high GPA
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Corey, a senior in History. I’ve taken a lot of history classes lately, both undergrad and through a minor. I’ve really enjoyed them, but I’m finding it harder to understand the concepts and apply them in real contexts. I’m also in a major, which is expected to require a lot of history in some way. I’m worried that if I don’t keep up, I might not make the GPA I’m trying to achieve or get into a good graduate program. I’d like some help understanding what I’m doing well in history and how to keep up, and how to make sure I’m doing well in my major and future studies.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by my philosophy course and uncertain about my future path
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Brian, a first-year Philosophy major. I’ve taken a few classes so far and really enjoyed some of the readings, but lately I’m feeling a lot more anxious than I used to. I’m worried that I’m not doing well enough to pass the course, and I’m also starting to wonder if I should be majoring in something else entirely. I’ve always been interested in the humanities, but I don’t know if I should be trying to pursue a serious academic field like philosophy at this early stage. I’d love to talk to someone about how to manage my workload and feel more confident in what I’m doing, and I think this is a good opportunity to get some support.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling lost and disconnected from the political process
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Christopher, a senior Political Science major. I’ve been doing well academically, but lately I’ve been feeling disillusioned about the state of the country and the political system. I used to be passionate about issues like climate change and inequality, but now I just don’t care anymore. I’m frustrated with the way politics is covered in the media and how politicians are able to manipulate public opinion. I’m worried that I’m losing interest in the system I’m trying to change and I don’t know if I should keep pushing or if I should just give up.

meeting_request.purpose: Help with adjusting to college and feeling overwhelmed in my math-heavy major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Antonio, a sophomore in the mathematics major. I’ve been doing well academically, with a 3.7 GPA so far. But I’m in a really heavy math-heavy track, and there’re a lot of coursework I’m taking that I don’t really understand or relate to. I’m also in a major that requires a lot of writing and critical thinking, and I find those assignments really difficult. I’m feeling overwhelmed and not sure if I’m doing well enough in my major or if I’m even on track. I’m reaching out because I’m starting to feel like I’m not living up to the expectations of the major I’ve chosen, even though I’m doing well academically.

meeting_request.purpose: Need help adjusting to college arts program and major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Thomas, a first-year art major. I’ve been attending the University of Chicago — a highly respected arts institution with a broad arts and humanities curriculum — and I’m really enjoying my art history and studio courses, but I’m still feeling a bit lost. I’m in my first semester, and the major and major requirement are still being finalized. I don’t have a lot of art experience, and I don’t know where to fit in. I’m not a visual artist, but I’m interested in making art and want to explore that direction. I’m also taking some writing and film courses, but I’m not sure how to integrate them into my art education. I’m feeling overwhelmed and unsure if I’m on the right path, and I’m having a hard time finding a good balance between academics and my artistic interests.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed and unsure if I can keep up in music-related courses
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Robin, a senior in music major. I’ve taken a lot of music courses lately, from improvisation to composition to performance. I’ve really enjoyed them, but I’m also feeling the pressure to show progress and get into a music industry or music education program. My peers are doing well, and I’m starting to feel like I’m falling behind. I don’t know if I can keep up, and I’m worried I’m missing out on a serious career path if I don’t figure this out. I’m interested in talking about how to stay committed and how to graduate strong in my music major.

meeting_request.purpose: Help deciding between graduate school and industry work or transfer to a different major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Phillip, a senior in Romance Languages. I’ve taken a lot of interesting courses, but not sure if graduate school is the right fit right now. I’ve been considering industry work or a nonprofit, but I’m not sure if I want to go back to a traditional academic setting. Also, I’m really passionate about Romance languages and literature, but I don’t know if I can make a living doing that. I’m open to exploring options, but I’m not sure where to start. Can you help me think through my career path and potential transfer options? I want to make sure I make the right decision.

meeting_request.purpose: Help with understanding chemistry material
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Lori, a third-year Chemistry major. Last semester was really hard — I struggled with most of my chemistry courses, and I’m still not fully recovered. My professor even gave me a low grade on one of my papers because I’d made mistakes in a lab. Now I’m trying to catch up, but it’s still really overwhelming. I’m feeling frustrated and lost, and I’m worried that I’ll fall behind again this semester. I’m interested in talking to someone about how to approach chemistry better this time around, and I’m hoping you can help me get on track.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by my history course and uncertain about my future
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Chelsea, a first-year History major. Last semester was really tough for me, and I started to feel a lot of anxiety and uncertainty about where I’m even going. I took a lot of history classes, and I ended up taking at least 10 different ones, including European and American history, World War II, and early modern Europe. I ended up taking about 3/4 of my load in one semester, and I ended up with a C+ average. I’m still struggling to balance schoolwork and personal life, and I’m worried that I’m not measuring up to what I’m doing in class or how I’m showing up. I’m really feeling like I’m not in control of what I’m doing or where I’m heading, and I’m worried I’m not going to graduate on time because of all the stress I’m putting in.

meeting_request.purpose: Help with improving my academic performance in Philosophy
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Carrie, a third-year Philosophy student. I’ve taken a lot of difficult and abstract courses lately, and I’m feeling frustrated. Some of my grades are still low, and I’m not sure if I should keep going or if I’ve reached a plateau. I’ve also been involved in some Philosophy-related clubs and events, and I’m trying to connect with the community, but I feel like I’m still not fully engaged. I’m interested in exploring my career options after undergraduate study, but I don’t know where to start or what to do. I want to talk to someone who can help me feel more confident, make progress, and figure out what's possible.

meeting_request.purpose: I'm having a hard time keeping up with the course material in my English honors seminar
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm April, a senior majoring in English. This is the second semester of my honors English course, and I’m really struggling to understand the complex ideas being covered. Some of the readings are really challenging and require deep analysis, and I’m finding it hard to separate between what I’ve already understood and what I need to understand now. I’m also feeling overwhelmed by the course load overall, with two other majors and a minor and a bunch of required writing courses. I’m not doing well in any of my other courses, and this is starting to affect my grades. I’m hoping to talk to someone about how to stay on track in this semester and improve my academic performance.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by my Philosophy course and uncertain about my future after college
meeting_request.description: Hi, my name is Joseph and I'm a first-year student in Philosophy. This is my first semester in college, and I’m really struggling with the course material. Some of the topics are really complex and I’m not sure I understand everything yet. I’m also feeling really anxious about what I’m learning and what I’ll be expected to do in college. I’m in a major that I’m not really passionate about, and I’m not sure if Philosophy is the right fit for me. I feel like I’m not doing well academically and I’m worried I’ll fail the course and feel like I’m falling behind.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by first-year classes and my major
meeting_request.description: Hi, my name is Nicholas and I'm a first-year student in English. I’m really enjoying my first-year English professor and some of the themes and topics we’re covering, but I also feel really nervous about the workload and whether I can keep up. I’ve also majored in history, and I’m not sure if that will help me in this major, especially since I’m not really interested in history anymore. I’m still new to college, and I’m worried I’m not doing well enough to fit in already.

meeting_request.purpose: Help deciding between graduate school and industry work
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Javier, a second-year majoring in East Asian Languages and Literatures. I’ve had a really strong academic experience, with a mix of classes in history, literature, and language. I’ve been really passionate about East Asian cultures and languages, and I’ve done well in my major. Recently, I’ve been thinking about graduate school or industry work as a way to further explore my interests, but I’m not sure what to do next. I’ve had a lot of faculty advisors, and I’ve been working on a thesis, but I’m not sure if that’s the right path. I’m also considering transferring to a different major, but I’m not sure what I’d like to do after graduation. I’m open to advice on graduate school, industry work, or something else, but I’m not sure where to start.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling lost and overwhelmed in my first-year physics course
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Richard, a first-year student in the physics major. I’ve been attending class regularly but still feel like I’m not understanding what we’re doing. Some of the topics we’re covering, like quantum mechanics or astrophysics, are really complex and abstract, and I’m still not sure if I’m making sense. I’m also experiencing academic burnout. I’ve been working hard in class, but I’m also feeling exhausted and overwhelmed by the material. I’m not sure if I should be in this course or if I should be taking something else, but I’m not sure what to do. I’m reaching out because I’m feeling lost and unsure if I’m even doing well in this major.

meeting_request.purpose: Help with adjusting to biology coursework and feeling overwhelmed by academic expectations
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Timothy, a senior biology major. I’ve been doing well academically, with a 3.7 GPA and a mix of biology and math courses. However, I’m feeling a bit lost lately. Some of my biology classes have covered different topics, and I’m not sure how to connect what I’m learning to real-world applications or how I’ll apply it. I’m also feeling pressure to do well in finals, which are coming up soon. I’m not sure if I should be worried about grades or if I’m just getting tired of the coursework. I’d like some guidance on how to stay on track and feel more confident in my biology studies.

meeting_request.purpose: Need help adjusting to college life and finding my place in the Asian American studies major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Keith, a first-year East Asian major. I’ve taken a few classes and already feel overwhelmed by the sheer number of courses and the variety of topics. I’m not particularly interested in traditional academic subjects like history or literature, but I’m not sure what else I should be doing. I also feel isolated from the Asian American community here, and I’m not sure if I belong in the Asian American studies major or if it’s just a bad fit. I’d really appreciate help understanding what I’m doing well in the program, how to engage more deeply with the coursework, and how to find a balance between academic exploration and personal growth.

meeting_request.purpose: Help deciding between graduate school and a different career path
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Kevin, a third-year majoring in East Asian Languages and Literatures. I’ve taken a lot of interesting courses, but I’m not sure if graduate school is the right fit for what I’ve been studying. My major is Chinese, and I’ve taken classes in Chinese literature, translation, and film, as well as history and philosophy of East Asian civilizations. I’ve also taken courses on globalization, migration, and cultural exchange, which have really engaged me. I’m considering applying to graduate programs in East Asian studies or international affairs, but I’m not sure if I should stay in the Asian studies track or switch to something else. I’m not sure what career path I’m interested in, but I’m interested in something related to language, education, or international relations. I’m worried about transferring if I don’t figure out what I want to do soon.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed and unsure of my ability to succeed in my major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Eric, a senior majoring in Physics and Astronomy. I’ve taken a lot of difficult and abstract courses lately, and I’m starting to feel like I’m falling behind. Some of the classes even overlap with my major, and I’m worried that I’m not doing enough to stay in the program. I’re also involved in a few student organizations, and I’m trying to balance them all while studying. I feel frustrated and uncertain about whether I’m even capable of doing what I’m doing in my major, and I’m not sure how to get help. I’m hoping to meet with a counselor or mentor who can help me plan out my coursework more effectively, or to discuss whether my approach is working or if I need to make any major changes.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling disheartened and uncertain about my academic progress
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Ashley, a senior Sociology and Anthropology major. Last semester was really tough — I struggled a lot in my sociology and anthropology courses, and I’m not sure if I did well enough to pass them. I’m also feeling overwhelmed by the rest of my major and some of my other coursework, and I’m worried that I’m falling behind and will fail the major if I don’t do better. I’m currently in a mix of anthropology and history courses, and I’m really interested in the intersection of humanity and culture, but I’m not sure I’m doing something meaningful with my major. I feel like I’m falling behind and afraid I’ll never catch up, and I’m worried I’ll drop out or lose interest if things keep getting this bad.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed and unsure of my academic path in art studies
meeting_request.description: Hi, my name is Richard, and I'm a second-year art major. Last semester was really tough — I struggled in most of my art classes, and I ended up with a D-average. It’s not like I didn’t do well in some of the more abstract or technical courses, but I just couldn’t keep up. I’m majoring in art because I’ve always loved art, and I’ve been really passionate about it. I’ve always thought I’d major in something like English or history, but now I’m not sure what I should be doing. I’m interested in art history, but I don’t know if that’s a good fit or if I should be majoring in something else entirely. I’m also interested in writing and performance, but I’m not sure how to combine those two in a way that makes sense. I’m trying to talk to my professors, but I’m not sure how to articulate what I’m really struggling with or what I’m asking for help on. I’m hoping to schedule an appointment soon so I can get some guidance.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed and unsure if I can keep up in this major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Bryce, a third-year Political Science major. I’ve taken a bunch of political science and international relations courses, but I’m finding it harder than ever to keep up with the content and the pace. Some of the classes even cover topics I don’t really care about, like immigration or human rights. I’m feeling frustrated and worried that I’m not doing well in this major, and I’m having a hard time expressing how much it’s been affecting me. I’d love to talk with someone about how to stay engaged in this coursework and improve my academic performance, but I don’t know where to find an honest counselor like you.

meeting_request.purpose: Help with understanding course material and estimating grades
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Randall, a third-year Computer Science major. Last semester was really hard, and I’m still struggling to understand the concepts in my classes. Some of the topics are really complex, and I’m not sure how to apply what I’ve learned to real-world problems. I also have a lot of coursework left, and I’m not sure if I can keep up with the grading schedule. I’m interested in working with a counselor to figure out how to improve my academic performance, but I’m not sure where to start. I’ve been in the computer science program, so I’m familiar with the course content, but I’m still feeling overwhelmed.

meeting_request.purpose: Help deciding between graduate school and working in environmental policy or academia
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Sheryl, a senior majoring in Earth & Environmental Geosciences. I’ve taken a lot of interesting courses, from climate change to geology to environmental policy. I’ve even interned with a nonprofit and really enjoyed it. But now I’m thinking about graduate school or working in environmental policy or academia. I don’t know which path would be best for me, and I’m feeling a bit overwhelmed. I want advice about whether to pursue graduate school right now or if I should take a year off and explore more options before applying. I also feel like the major I chose is not explicitly focused on policy, and I don’t want to end up doing something that doesn’t align with my long-term goals.

meeting_request.purpose: Help with understanding economics course material
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Calvin, a third-year Economics major. Last semester was really hard — I had to take a bunch of economics courses, and I ended up falling behind — I was behind in my intro courses and had to retake some of them. It was overwhelming, and I ended up feeling confused and frustrated. Now I'm in a few different economics classes, and I'm still not sure what this stuff means. I'm not really interested in business or finance, but I still feel like I'm not making sense of what I'm learning. I'm trying to take some different courses this semester, but I'm not sure if I'm on track. I'm also worried that I'm not passing enough courses to graduate on time, which is making me even more anxious about my major.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by first-year classes and my major
meeting_request.description: Hi, my name is Martin and I'm in the first year of undergraduate study. I’m majoring in English and have taken a few classes so far, but I’m already feeling a lot of pressure to perform well. Some of the courses are really challenging and I’m not sure if I’m ready to tackle them at this level. I’m also dealing with some personal issues that are making me anxious, and I’m not sure how to balance all this stress with my personal life. I’m feeling really isolated and unsure of who I am as a student or a person right now.

meeting_request.purpose: Need help with writing assignments and identifying a career path
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Denise, a junior majoring in Writing and Rhetoric. I’ve taken a lot of writing courses and done well in them, but lately my writing has been getting worse. I’m trying to write essays for grad school applications, but I keep getting stuck on the same issues. I also do a lot of academic writing, like reviewing books or summarizing articles, but I don’t see how what I’m doing is relevant to my major. I feel like I’m not even close to understanding what to do with my degree, and I’m having a hard time finding a career path that fits. I’m hoping to talk with someone about how to improve my writing and explore options for graduate school or other writing-related jobs.

meeting_request.purpose: Need help improving writing skills in my major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Francisco, a senior majoring in English. I've been doing okay academically, but lately I've been struggling with writing assignments. Most of the material I'm working on is literary criticism, and I find it hard to connect with the text on a deep level. I'm also feeling overwhelmed by the course load and feel like I'm not keeping up. I'm not sure if I'm doing anything wrong or if I need help, and I'm worried that I'm falling behind because of my major. I'm hoping to talk to someone who can help me improve my writing and feel more confident in my work.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling down and struggling with depression and uncertainty about my next steps
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Christopher, a senior Religious Studies major. Last semester was really tough — I had to transition from a completely different major (psychology) to Religion, and it was a big adjustment. I felt really low at times, especially during the pandemic when everything felt overwhelming. Now I’m trying to figure out what’s next, and I’m still feeling a bit anxious about what I’ll do after graduation. I’m open to talking about depression, anxiety, graduation stress, or anything else related to post-graduation adjustment. I’ve talked to some professors and peers, but I’m still feeling alone in how I feel.

meeting_request.purpose: Need help adjusting academically
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Jessica, a second-year math major. Last semester was really tough — I fell behind in most of my courses, and I had to take a bunch of electives just to stay in the math track. Now I’m trying to catch up, but everything is getting harder. I’m still struggling with math concepts, and I’m getting frustrated. I’m also dealing with some personal issues that are affecting my academic performance, and I don’t know if I’m falling apart or if I’m just not cut out for math. I’m open to talking about how to improve academically, but I’m not sure where to start. I want someone who can help me navigate this challenging major and work out a plan for improvement.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by my Philosophy course and uncertain about my future after college
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Melanie, a first-year majoring in Philosophy. I’ve taken a few classes so far and am really enjoying the content, but I’m also feeling really stressed out. I’ve been working on a lot of papers, and some of them are really challenging and require a lot of thinking. I’m worried that I won’t be able to handle college-level work, and I’m starting to feel like I’m not measuring up. I also feel a little bit over overwhelmed by all the academic expectations for college students, especially since I’m not really sure what my major even means anymore. I’d love to talk about how to manage my academic load, deal with stress, and figure out if Philosophy is even a good fit for me.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed and unsure of my ability to succeed in the theater program
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Erin, a senior majoring in theater. Last semester was really tough — I had a lot of coursework in the major, including a seminar on theater history, a seminar on film and performance, and a theater elective I really enjoyed. But then I took a bunch of upper-level theater courses, and I started to feel like I was overloading and losing ground. I ended up taking a bunch of classes I shouldn’t have been taking, and I started to feel like I was falling behind both academically and artistically. Now I’m feeling really discouraged and unsure if I can keep up. I’m in a really good theater major, but I don’t feel like I’m doing anything particularly well in it. I’m not doing well in any of my theater classes, and I’m struggling to keep up with the reading and assignments. I’m worried that I’m going to fall behind and lose confidence in my ability to succeed in the major.

meeting_request.purpose: Dealing with emotional distress after a disappointing academic experience
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Carlos, a senior Art major. Last semester I took a course in art history that I found challenging and uninteresting. I’ve been struggling with the material, and I’m not sure if I should have even tried it. After the first few weeks, I started to feel really down. I didn’t want to do the work anymore, and I started avoiding art-related activities. Now I’m in a major course, and I’m really invested in it, but I’m also really scared of failing. I feel like everyone else in my class is doing better than me, and I’m starting to feel like a failure. I don’t know if I should be still in the course, or if I should drop out. I’m reaching out because I’m worried about how to cope with this emotional distress, and I’m not sure who to talk to.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by my history course and uncertain about my future in academia
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Sharon, a first-year History major. I’ve taken a few history courses and really enjoyed them, but I’m also in a major with a lot of math and science courses, and I’m still feeling like I don’t quite fit in with the academic culture here. I’m not sure if I should be in this major, and I’m worried that I’m not measuring up academically. I’m also really interested in writing and history, but I don’t know how to connect what I’m learning to something meaningful or how to do research. I’m attending a private university with a very strong academic culture, and I’m feeling like everyone else is already ahead of me, but I don’t know if I belong here.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by first-year coursework and uncertain about my major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Mark, a first-year student in Romance Languages. I’ve taken a mix of English and Spanish classes, and while I’ve enjoyed some of the content, I’m feeling like I’m doing a lot of work and not getting anywhere. My grades are still in the high range, but I’m starting to feel like I’m not measuring up to what I’m doing, and I’m starting to wonder if I should major in something like French or Italian instead. I’m also feeling burned out from school, with long days and a lot of work ahead. I’m not sure if I’m doing okay, and I’m worried I’m falling behind or missing something important.

meeting_request.purpose: Frustrated and unsure of my ability to succeed in my major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Monica, a second-year math major. I’ve taken a lot of math courses, both core and elective, and I’ve really enjoyed them all. I’ve even been able to earn high grades, but now I feel like I’m falling behind and not really understanding what I’m doing wrong. I’m still in a major that requires a lot of math, and I’m not sure if I should be trying to major in math or if I should be switching to something else. I’m also involved in a few math-focused clubs and trying to connect with the community, but I feel overwhelmed by all the material and feel like I’m not doing enough to succeed.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by first-year coursework and uncertain about my major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Joshua, a first-year student in Earth & Environmental Geosciences. I’m still in my first semester, and already feeling the pressure to do well in all my classes. Some of my classes are really challenging, with topics like climate change, earthquakes, and geology. I’m also majoring in Environmental Studies, which is a broad field with a lot of overlap. It’s hard not to get caught up in everything I’m reading and hearing about, and I’m starting to feel overwhelmed. I’m not sure if I should be taking all these classes, and I’m starting to feel like I’m not measuring up to what I’m doing. I’m also worried about majoring in something I don’t really care about, and I’m starting to wonder if I’m making the right choice.

meeting_request.purpose: Struggling to adjust to college and feeling overwhelmed
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Margaret, a first-year Chemistry major. I’ve taken a few classes and already feel like I’m behind, both academically and emotionally. I’m worried that I’ll fail this semester and feel like I’m not living up to what I’m doing. I’d like some support dealing with my anxiety and feeling isolated in my major. I’m in a good academic unit, but I’m not sure how to make friends or find a community that can help me. I’m excited to be in college, but I’m still feeling like an outsider.

meeting_request.purpose: Struggling to keep up with advanced Romance Languages courses
meeting_request.description: Hi, my name is Gary Andrade and I'm a second-year Romance Languages major. Last semester was really tough for me — I took a bunch of Romance courses, including “Romantic Poetry and Prose”, “The Romantic Revolution”, and “Romanticism and Modernity”, and I ended up falling behind and feeling overwhelmed. This semester, I’m taking “Romanticism and Literary Theory” and “Romanticism and Film”, and I’m worried that I’ll be even more behind than last time. I’m still really enjoying Romance, but I’m starting to feel like I’m not cut out for these kinds of courses yet, and I’m worried I’ll fall behind again if I don’t work hard. I want to talk to someone about how to stay on track in these courses and whether I’m doing enough to succeed this semester.

meeting_request.purpose: Need help adjusting academically
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Karen, a senior Economics major. Last semester was really tough — I failed most of my courses, and I’m currently on academic probation. It’s been really hard to focus on anything else, and I’m not sure if I can make it through this semester. I’ve been working hard on coursework, but I’m not sure if I’m even on the right track. I’d love to talk to someone about how to improve my academic performance and feel more confident in my major. I’m open to any advice, from course selection to graduation requirements, but I’m really struggling right now.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by first-year classes and my major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Melissa, a first-year English major. I’ve taken two difficult classes so far and feel like I’m falling behind. I’m worried that I’ll fail these majors and feel like I’m not cut out for college. I’m also dealing with anxiety around school and personal goals. I’d like some support dealing with my first semester and how to manage academically.

meeting_request.purpose: Help deciding between graduate school and working in the Middle East
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Jason, a second-year majoring in Middle East Languages and Literature. I’ve really enjoyed my major and have been doing well academically. However, I’m still not sure if graduate school is the right path for me or if I should consider working in the Middle East after graduation. I’m also interested in exploring other career paths that involve working with the Middle East or studying the region, but I’m not sure where to start.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by first-year classes and my major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Veronica, a first-year English major. Last semester was really tough for me — I felt really confused about what I’m supposed to be doing, and my major was actually not clearly defined. I ended up taking a variety of classes, from literature to history to creative writing, and ended up with a 2.5 GPA. I’m still not sure what I want to do with my degree, and I’m feeling really anxious about graduation and what comes next. I’m in a really good academic community here, but I’m also feeling isolated and unsure how to connect with others who are going through similar experiences.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by my first-year History class and uncertain about my ability to succeed
meeting_request.description: Hi, my name is Angela and I'm a first-year student in the History program. I’ve taken a few classes so far, including a first-year seminar and a history of science course. I’ve enjoyed the material in both, but I’m feeling a lot more anxious lately than I was before class. Some of the topics are really complex and I’m still learning a lot, and I’m starting to feel like I’m not doing well in the class. I also feel like I don’t quite fit in with the other students in the class, which is making me even more anxious. I’m worried that I’m not good enough to be in this major, and I’m having a hard time processing whether or not I should even be in the course.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by my first-year geography course and unsure if I can keep up
meeting_request.description: Hi, I'm Nancy, a first-year student in geography. I’ve taken a rigorous introductory course this semester and already feel like I’m behind. I’m also feeling a bit burned out from school already, and I’m not sure if I can keep up this level of academic engagement. I’m not in any particularly tight academic bind yet, but I’m worried that I’m going to fall behind and feel really bad if I don't keep up.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed by first-year Biology classes and academic expectations
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Bridget, a first-year Biology major. I’ve taken two biology classes so far and really enjoyed them, but I’m also in a honors-level English course and a philosophy class. My academic load is heavy, and I’m feeling like I’m not keeping up with everything. I’m worried that I’m not going to be able to keep up with this major, and I’m starting to feel really anxious and stressed. I’m not sure if I’m doing well enough to succeed in this major, and I’m worried about whether I’m even qualified to be a Biology major.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling lost and overwhelmed in my Middle East Languages and Literature course
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Aaron, a second-year student majoring in Middle East Languages and Literatures. I’ve taken a really challenging course this semester, covering topics like Arabic poetry, Islamic art, and the Quran. I’m really struggling to understand anything, and I’m feeling like I’m falling behind and panicking about graduation. I’ve also been dealing with academic pressure and anxiety from other classes, but this one feels different. It’s really immersive and intense, and I’m worried I’m not doing enough to succeed. I’m hoping to talk with a counselor about how to stay on track, but I’m not sure how to make an appointment or what to say. I’m excited to work together to get better, but I’m feeling really down right now.

meeting_request.purpose: Help with deciding between graduate school and working in social justice or community organizing
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Lisa, a senior majoring in Sociology and Anthropology. I’ve taken a lot of interesting courses lately, from social inequality to race and class, and I’ve really enjoyed exploring these topics. But now I’m starting to think about graduate school or working in a social justice organization, and I’m not sure which path would be best. I’ve been in a social justice class last semester, and it was really engaging, but I also had a lot of class participation and I’m not sure if I would be able to do that in a professional setting. I’m also interested in community organizing or social justice work, but I don’t know if that’s even a legitimate career path right now. I’m feeling really uncertain and overwhelmed, and I’m not sure if I should be taking classes or applying to graduate programs right now. I’d really appreciate help figuring out what I should do next.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed and unsure if I'm doing well enough in my major
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Christina, a senior Psychology major. This semester has been especially tough — I’m taking a lot of different courses, including some really challenging ones like addiction psychology and trauma intervention, and I’m feeling like I’m falling behind. I’ve been working hard, but I’m also starting to question if I even like psychology or if I should be majoring in something else. I’m struggling to focus and feel like I’m losing interest, even though I’ve really enjoyed some of the content I’m learning. I feel like I’m not doing well enough in class to pass, but I also feel like I’m not really engaged with the material enough to pass on my own. I’m worried that I’m falling behind and that I’m not going to graduate on time, which would be devastating for my mental health and my future.

meeting_request.purpose: Feeling overwhelmed and unsure if I can keep up in music-related courses
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Jonathan, a senior majoring in Music. Last semester was really challenging — I took a few music courses that were really difficult, and I’m still struggling to keep up. Some of the songs I’m playing are really complex and I’m still not sure if I can keep up with the tempo or understanding. I’m also worried about what comes next after graduation. I’m interested in business or arts management, but I don’t know if I’m even eligible to apply for jobs or internships if I major in music. I’m trying to talk to professors, but I feel overwhelmed and not sure where to start. I need help understanding how to handle this stress and figure out what to do next.
